arm_group.description: In Platelet rich fibrin+ATV group PRF combined with 10 µl of 1.2% ATV was inserted into the depth of the IBD
In Platelet rich fibrin group PRF was inserted into the depth of the IBD.
open flap debridement was followed by no grafting or regenerative intervention.

brief_summary.textblock:
Current study was designed to evaluate the combined efficacy of PRF and 1.2% ATV gel with
      open flap debridement (OFD) in treatment of intrabony defects in chronic periodontitis
      subjects.

clinical_study.brief_title: PLATELET RICH FIBRIN COMBINED WITH 1.2% ATORVASTATIN FOR TREATMENT OF INTRABONY DEFECTS IN CHRONIC PERIODONTITIS

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

        the presence of 3- wall IBD ≥3 mm deep (distance between alveolar crest and base of the
        defect on an intraoral periapical radiograph [IOPA]) along with an interproximal probing
        depth (PD) ≥5 mm after phase I therapy (scaling and root planing [SRP]) in asymptomatic
        teeth.

        Exclusion Criteria:

        1) Agressive Periodontitis subjects; 2) Systemic conditions known to affect the
        periodontal status; 3) medications known to affect the outcomes of periodontal therapy; 4)
        Hematological disorders and insufficient platelet count (<200,000/mm3); 5)
        pregnancy/lactation; and 6) Smoking and tobacco use in any form 7) Immunocompromised
        individuals.

facility.name: Govt dental college and research institute

primary_outcome.description: Defect depth reduction will be assessed from baseline to 9 month post operatively on radiographs

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

responsible_party.investigator_affiliation: Government Dental College and Research Institute, Bangalore

secondary_outcome.description: probing depth will be assessed from gingival margin to pocket depth at baseline and 9 months postoperatively
RAL will be assesed from fixed point on the stent at baseline and 9 months postoperatively
plaque levels were assessed at baseline and 9 months postoperatively
gingival bleeding was assesed at baseline and 9 months postoperatively
change in gingival margin levels were assesed at baseline and 9 months
